headline: amazon, tesla stocks lead magnificent 7 surge after us-china temporary trade truce
text: amazon and tesla stocks led the magnificent seven big tech stock surge after the us and china announced a temporary trade war truce.

headline: secrets behind magnificent 7 surge ahead of nvidia earnings
text: you can catch opening bid on apple podcasts, spotify, youtube, or wherever you get your podcasts. the magnificent 7 stocks are performing strongly again, even with chipmaker nvidia s earnings report not due until may 28. this leadership group, which had largely underperformed in 2025 due to valuation concerns and macroeconomic risks, has seen a rally since the april 8 lows. this resurgence can be attributed to a couple of key factors. first, tech mega-caps like microsoft (msft) and alphabet (googl (googl)) significantly exceeded earnings estimates. barclays data indicates that these large-cap tech companies beat analyst earnings estimates by an average of 8% in the first quarter. second, the earnings growth for these major tech players in the first quarter was once again impressive. goldman sachs (gs) data reveals that large-cap tech stocks within the mag 7 achieved an average earnings growth of 28% in the first quarter, compared to just 9% for the other 493 stocks in the s p 500. for full episodes of opening bid, listen on your favorite podcast platform or watch on our website. yahoo finance s opening bid is produced by langston sessoms

headline: trump s ftc antitrust cops just got a loud warning about blocking tech tie-ups
text: president trump s antitrust cops just received a loud warning about attempts to block any future technology mergers as the ftc lost an attempt to undo microsoft s $69 billion acquisition of gaming giant activision blizzard.

headline: trump announces total reset with new china trade deal
text: president trump announced a 90-day trade deal with china, which will reduce tariffs to 10% from 125%.

headline: apple stock rises on tariff relief, but services challenges remain overhang
text: apple stock rose after the u.s. and china agreed to a cooling-off period on tariffs. but services business challenges remain an overhang.

headline: apple mulls iphone price hikes but wants to avoid blaming tariffs, report says
text: apple is reportedly considering raising prices on its next generation of iphones expected to be released this fall but without pinning higher costs on tariffs.

headline: your new iphone may get more expensive. apple won t blame tariffs report.
text: after retailer amazon was blasted by the white house for potentially citing the tariffs as part of the price on goods purchased by u.s. consumers, apple is determined to avoid a similar fate.

headline: apple might be loading up some iphone price hikes
text: tariffs or no tariffs, apple (aapl) wants to raise the prices of iphones and plans to do everything possible not to blame president donald trump for the hike.

headline: stocks to watch monday nvidia, amd, broadcom, apple
text: amazon (amzn) apple (aapl) meta (meta) tesla (tsla) the biggest u.s. tech stocks surged after the white house and china agreed to substantial tariff cuts. among them, amazon sells many chinese-made products on its platform china is an important market for tesla and apple does much of its assembly in the country.

headline: trump signals he could speak with china s xi by end of the week
text: president donald trump said on monday that he could speak with china s president xi jinping at the end of the week amid progress between the two economic rivals on a trade deal. trump said the negotiations between the two countries this past weekend has led to a reset between the two nations. (reporting by steve holland, jarrett renshaw editing by nick zieminski)

headline: china s march shipments of foreign-branded cellphones drop almost 50%
text: chinese shipments of foreign-branded cellphones, including apple inc s iphones, dropped by 49.6% year on year in march, according to data released on monday by a government-affiliated research company. calculations based on the data from the china academy of information and communications technology (caict) showed that march shipments of foreign-branded phones in china decreased to 1.887 million units from 3.747 million a year earlier.

headline: with warren buffett stepping down as ceo, will berkshire hathaway sell apple stock
text: greg abel will replace the legendary ceo warren buffett at the end of the year. apple stock has been the hallmark of buffett s leadership. apple is facing many challenges that could be a significant headwind to its growth.

headline: apple considers raising iphone prices, wsj reports
text: the technology giant s shares were up 7% in premarket trading, tracking gains in the wider market after washington and beijing agreed to temporarily slash the reciprocal tariffs on monday. apple is among the most prominent firms caught in u.s.-china trade tensions, which intensified in recent months after a series of tariffs initiated by president donald trump.

headline: apple considers raising iphone prices, without blaming tariffs
text: the company wants to avoid appearing to attribute price increases to u.s. tariffs on goods from china, where most apple devices are assembled.

headline: is meta platforms a better magnificent seven stock to buy right now than apple
text: meta s stock performance, growth, and valuation are better than apple s. apple also faces more uncertainty over the next few years than meta does. both stocks could be winners for long-term investors, but meta appears to be the better pick right now.
